thread.title: AlpineSheep

author: AlpineSheep
title: AlpineSheep
text: I purchased two 5-6' black locust trees and two 2-year-old American chestnut trees. I selected the option for the trees to be delivered in the spring. I live in Maryland, and the trees arrived in early March. The whole order arrived in one narrow/long box that I was not sure would contain all I had ordered, but I needn't have worried. All trees were bound securely together inside bubble wrap with roots wrapped up in a plastic bag containing some sort of hydrating gel medium. The 5-6' saplings were pruned essentially branchless, the chestnut saplings bore 4-5 branches each. All trees were dormant but alive and healthy by all appearances. I was able to plant them the next day, and as far as I can tell now (nearly 3 weeks later) they are still alive but have yet to show any further outward signs of activity/growth. I expect they may remain like this for another week or three. All in all I am so far very pleased with my experience with Willis Orchards, their website was easy to navigate, their stock seems good and of good quality, and what service I have received has been good. Hopefully the trees will continue to do well though if they don't at this point it would likely be the weather's or my own fault.
